Package com.phasmidsoftware.dsaipg.adt.pq

Interface PriorityQueue<K>

All Known Implementing Classes:
PriorityQueue_BinaryHeap
public interface PriorityQueue<K>
An interface that represents a priority queue structure, allowing efficient addition and extraction of elements based on their priority. The priority queue may support maximum or minimum priority orders depending on its implementation.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    boolean
    getMax()
    Determines if this is a max-Priority Queue.
    void
    give(K key)
    Attempts to add the specified element to the priority queue.
    void
    heapConstructor()
    Constructs or initializes the underlying data structure for the Priority Queue in order to prepare it for efficient insertion and extraction operations.
    boolean
    isEmpty()
    Checks if the priority queue is empty.
    K
    peek(int k)
    Retrieves the element at the specified position in the priority queue without removing it.
    int
    size()
    Retrieves the number of elements currently stored in the priority queue.
    K
    take()
    Removes and returns the highest-priority element from the priority queue.

  • Method Details

    • isEmpty

      boolean isEmpty()
      Checks if the priority queue is empty.
      Returns:
      true if the priority queue contains no elements, false otherwise.

    • size

      int size()
      Retrieves the number of elements currently stored in the priority queue.
      Returns:
      the number of elements in the priority queue.

    • give

      void give(K key)
      Attempts to add the specified element to the priority queue. If the key has low priority, it will be spilled.
      Parameters:
      key - the element to be added to the priority queue

    • take

      K take() throws PQException
      Removes and returns the highest-priority element from the priority queue. If max is false (it's a minimum PQ), then this will result in the smallest item. If the queue is empty, throws a PQException.
      Returns:
      the highest-priority element in the priority queue (assuming getMax() is true).
      Throws:
      PQException - if the priority queue is empty.

    • heapConstructor

      void heapConstructor()
      Constructs or initializes the underlying data structure for the Priority Queue in order to prepare it for efficient insertion and extraction operations. Typically used to build the heap representation of the priority queue based on its current elements. Useful for the heap construction phase of HeapSort.

    • peek

      K peek(int k)
      Retrieves the element at the specified position in the priority queue without removing it. WARNING: this is primarily for testing -- not recommended for general use.
      Parameters:
      k - the position index of the element to peek at, where 0 represents the highest priority element.
      Returns:
      the element at the specified position in the priority queue.

    • getMax

      boolean getMax()
      Determines if this is a max-Priority Queue. WARNING: this is primarily for testing -- not recommended for general use.
      Returns:
      true if the maximum value is present, false otherwise.
